result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick A McDaniel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as receiption facility.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently serving.

Same conditions as Probation.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently serving.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must have no contact with Deborah T.
Must have no contact with Joshua R.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
Sentence to be served in Barron County.
Must report to Barron County Jail no later than May 14, 2016 at 5:00 PM.  If released from Sawyer County earlier, must report to Barron County Jail immediately.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State finds no corrections in PSI.  Defense notes a change.  No jail credit.
Brenda B. addresses the court on behalf of defendant.
State recommends imposed and stayed 3 years, 6 months, prison.  1 year, 6 months initial incarceration,  2 years extended supervision.
Probation 3 years
6 months conditional jail consecutive to Sawyer Co. cases 14CF72 & 15CM182.
Defense recommends 3 years probation with 6 months conditional jail time.
Defendant addresses court.
Court relates and orders:  imposed and stayed 3 years, 6 months prison.  1 year, 6 months initial incarceration, 2 years extended supervision, Consecutive to any sentence currently serving.
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and substance abuse program. Dodge reception facility.

Probation 3 years
6 months conditional jail to be served in Barron County, consecutive to Sawyer Co. cases 14CF72 & 15CM182, reporting no later than 05/14/2016 at 5 p.m. and if released earlier from Sawyer Co., must report to Barron County Jail immediately.
 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with any evaluations/treatment recommendations from probation.
Obtain and maintain employment.
Provide DNA Sample and pay surcharge.
Court costs.
6 mo. drivers license revocation.
No contact with Deborah T.
No contact with Joshua R.

WEDS given to defendant.
Order to Submit DNA Specimen on May 14th, 2016, provided to defendant.
Voters rights ineligibility form given.
Firearm admonition given to defendant.

CASE RECALLED:
Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  John M. O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea agreement;  Defendant pleads guilty to cournt 4.  Court finds factual basis.    The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty
Bond to continue.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel in court.  John M. O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody in Rusk County.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Reset.
Bond to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reading of Information filed.  Not guilty plea entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in another jail.
  Arraignment scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Derrick A McDaniel in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense waives further reading of complaint.
Defendant waives right to preliminary examination.  Court questions defendant and accepts defendant's waiver for the same.
Court finds probable cause.  Bound over.

  Arraignment scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
